screens

join me and rise of kingdoms by clicking

enemies it's going to be fun now back to
the episode high ORAC Civello the Beast
of Omaha stories from d-day born and met
Singh in Germany to a farming family in
1923 Heinrich sever law was conscripted
into the Vayner mocked at the age of 19
in 1942 according to his memoir he was
first stationed in Hanover with the 19th
light artillery division before being
transferred to France in August 1942
there he served with the 320 1st
Artillery Regiment as a dispatch rider
before being sent to the Eastern Front
in December in December 1942 several Oh
was reprimanded from making dissenting
remarks and punished so severely that he
spent 6 months in the hospital he was
sent home to his family farm before
being recalled to military service once
more severloh was sent to brunswick
germany in October 1943 for
noncommissioned officer training but was
stationed with the three
50 second Infantry Division after less
than a month their severloh then went to
Normandy where he was stationed with 29
others in a German stronghold at Omaha
Beach as Allied forces approached on
June 6th 1944 he was in vitas tons nests
62 or resistance nests 62 under the
command of lieutenant Bernhard fracking
which was armed with artillery guns
rocket launchers and machine guns zero
500 hours the fog had faded away and
severloh could see the assembles mass of
enemy ships on the horizon then he heard
a drone of bombers everyone in wn-62
jumped into a dugout or bunker as bombs
ring down however they had missed their
target instead hitting the areas behind
the strong points then after a short
pause the ship's now opened fire
bombarding the shore according to sever
law thick bright grey chalk dust filled
the air smoked in the dirt flying around
black in the sky interspersed with
flashing bolts of lightning it seemed as
if the whole world would disappear in
the roaring howling and crashing inferno
of exploding shells some of the men in
wn-62 were only slightly wounded but
none were killed a severloh looked up
and returned to his mg42 machine gun he
saw 48 landing craft getting closer to
the beach according to several own he
and his fellow German troops received
orders from lieutenant Bearheart firkin
to fire when the enemy was knee-deep in
the water and still unable to run
quickly as the American soldiers waited
in the water the order was given and all
at once the mortars machine guns and
field guns opened fire causing panic
among the first enemy wave many soft
cover behind the tank obstacles severloh
opened fire with the mg42 machine gun at
the American troops he was fed
ammunition by a soldier he didn't know
he recalled one of his shots as it
struck an American soldier in the head -
first the steel helmet fell off than his
chin fell on
severloh watched as the water sprayed up
where the machine-gun bursts had landed
and when the small fountains came closer
to the gis they threw themselves down
very soon the first bodies were drifting
in the waves of the rising tide he aims
slightly beyond the dark shapes that
were the corpses of GIS has more men
drifted in the tide behind them in a
short time the Americans down there had
been taken down severloh claimed he
fired his machine gun for nine straight
hours firing around twelve thousand
rounds he only took breaks to reload or
to let the weapon cool down while
reloading one or two Americans would
take the opportunity to move closer only
to be shot down by one of the other
Gunners in the bunker as his mg42 cooled
down several low fired a rifle instead
after his regular ammo ran out he used
rounds intended for anti-aircraft fire
where every fifth round was a tracer
round this led to his detection by the
USS Frankfurt he was fired upon he took
cover just in time before the shells
could hit him although shrapnel had hit
his face his gun was damaged and finally
rendered useless it's hot barrel had
even caused a small grass fire the
shells were now causing havoc on their
position and some US soldiers were
getting closer to his position it was
time to get out of there Frere King
shook several OHS hand and ordered him
to retreat several oh and his fellow
Germans retreated from the bunker and
they all took cover from the American
gun fire only himself and another German
soldier Kurt Vonnegut made it when
Veronica got to severloh he told him
frere King had been shot in the head
together they reached the nearby village
of Koval cermet where their battalion HQ
was and several all received medical
care the Germans including several all
surrendered to American troops On June
7th 1944 severloh was sent to Boston
Massachusetts as a prisoner of war
before being sent to England in 1946
where he worked as a forced labour until
March 1947 severloh then returned to
Germany to his family's farm
in 1960 several Oh contacted American
veteran chaplain David Silva who had
been shot three times at Omaha Beach the
men met several times and their story is
featured in a documentary by Alexander
Chihuahua about their unusual friendship
path of forgiveness a long way back to
Omaha Beach severe lows memoir wn-62 a
German soldiers memories of the defense
of Omaha Beach Normandy June 6 1944 was
published in the year 2000 severloh
claimed that he took out more than 1,000
men most likely more than 2,000 there is
no way to substantiate several Louis
assertions and many historians doubt
their validity the total US casualties
at Omaha Beach were between nineteen
hundred and three thousand Heinrich
several law became known as the Beast of
Omaha but this was only given to him by
the post-war media several law was
actually deeply haunted by his actions
but noted that he had a duty to
lieutenant fracking for several O's
claims to be accurate he would have been
responsible for most of the casualties
at Omaha Beach historians don't doubt
his significance in the event nor do
they question the effectiveness of the
machine guns on Omaha Beach but no exact
totals for one lone gunner can be known
several ou would die and walk in North
Germany in 2006 at the age of 82
